alert.note: Alert for Volusia (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 29 at 9:51AM EDT until September 29 at 12:00PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: The National Weather Service in Melbourne has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Volusia County in east central Florida... * Until noon EDT. * At 951 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 8 and 13 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Daytona Beach, Port Orange, DeLand, New Smyrna Beach, South Daytona, Lake Helen, Daytona Beach Shores, Daytona Beach Airport, Daytona International Speedway, Ponce Inlet, Spruce Creek, Samsula-Spruce Creek, Allandale, Harbor Oaks, Wilbur By The Sea, New Smyrna Beach Airport, Glencoe and DeLand Southwest. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
